newsitem.title: GERMANY: SAP tumbles after profit warning.
newsitem.headline: SAP tumbles after profit warning.

text.p: Shares in German business software firm SAP AG tumbled 20 percent in pre-bourse trade after the company issued a profit warning.
SAP ordinary shares were down 53 marks at 219.50 marks, while SAP preference shares were down 53.10 marks to 224.50, having hit a low of 210 marks in heavy early computer trade.
The IBIS DAX index started lower and in early trade was down 13.66 points, or 0.50 percent, at 2,708.08 points.
The high-flying company stunned markets on Tuesday evening with an unexpectedly sharp slowdown in growth in the third quarter that forced the company to revise full-year forecasts.
SAP revised down its 1996 revenue forecast to 3.5 billion marks from the 3.8 billion marks previously expected.
